item.title: The Sims 2: Highest Paying Careers
item.description:
Summary

  • Natural Science, Music, and Journalism are some of the best-paying careers in The Sims 2.
  • Sims in these careers can earn up to 10,497 to 13,800 simoleons per week once they reach the top level.
  • Intelligence and Show Business careers also offer high pay, with top earners making 15,000 and 15,066 simoleons per week respectively.

There are many ways to play The Sims 2 , but for Sims (and players) driven by a need for wealth, finding the highest-paying career might be the first question that comes to mind. Sims can take jobs in The Sims 2 by checking the newspaper or using a computer. However, jobs pay differently at different levels of the ladder.

These are the best-paying careers in The Sims 2 , once they have reached the peak, assuming that Sims are able to produce the elbow and nose grease to slither their way to the top of the food chain. Building skills and making friends are requirements for advancements in all jobs, and these are no exceptions.

10 The Natural Science Career Track

Like Science, But Natural (And Better Paying)

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 325 per day, § 1,625 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 10,497 per day, § 10,497 per week

Not only is natural science one of the most lucrative jobs at the top, but its entry position (ratkeeper) is also one of the best-paid jobs. Making a career out of understanding the natural world brings in the tenth-most payout of all the most prosperous careers, but it has benefits that make it one of the best in the game.The career object rewards is a murderous plant, the Cowplant, that can extend a sim's lifespan.

Should the natural science sim stay on at the top level (the ecological guru) they will find this extra life a worthy asset as they are only required to work one day a week for a payout of 10,497 simoleons per day. The Body, Logic, Cleaning and Mechanic skills must be mastered to advance in this track, and a university degree is required to even enter this career.

9 The Music Career Track

A Symphony Of Ka-Ching! Sounds

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 125 per day, § 625 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 2,830 per day, § 11,320 per week

Starting out as a musician, true to life, is tough in The Sims 2 , with the low 125 simoleons per day for the entry position of a record store clerk. While it isn't slacker levels of low, it can be tough to survive. However, at the upper levels, Sims can expect to lead a comfortable life.

The highest-level job, Rock God, still requires Sims to work four days a week, but the status and cash flow that it brings in is worth it at 11,320 simoleons per week. The career reward object is a cool guitar, which is rad for rockstars who are into that kind of thing.

8 The Journalism Career Track

A World Where Reporters Are Paid More Than The Mayor

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 115 per day, § 575 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 2,350 per day, § 11,750 per week

It is hard to imagine that a person who makes a living covering the news makes any serious amount of cash in their endeavors. However, in The Sims 2 , those who manage to break free of the yearbook supervisor entry gig will find the reportage of daily events lucrative.

By the eighth step of the ladder, the investigative journalist makes around the same as a judge from the political career, and as a media magnate, journalism's top job, the notepad-carrying Sim can expect to take home more than a mayor with 11,750 simoleons per week.

7 The Oceanography Career Track

Deep Waters, Deeper Pockets

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 185 per day, § 925 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 3,970 per day, § 11,910 per week

Starting as a fish chummer might not sound glamorous, but the oceanography career in The Sims 2 is a hidden gem for Sims who love the majesty of the sea. With an entry-level wage of 185 bucks per day, it’s a solid start.

However, the real treasure lies at the top, or rather, the bottom. As the hand of Poseidon, Sims will rake in 3,970 simoleons per day, or §11,910 per week, and can float with the satisfaction of swimming in the same waters as a god.

6 The Entertainment Career Track

Pulling Out More Than Rabbits

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 172 per day, § 860 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 2,730 per day, § 13,650 per week

For Sims with a flair for the dramatic, the entertainment career offers a star-studded path to fame and fortune. Starting as a stand-up comic at 172 Sim buckeroos per day, it’s a modest beginning.

Entertainers also have to suffer from having a beat-up ride for the first seven steps. However, the payoff is worth the grind. At the top, as a world-renowned prestidigitator, Sims will conjure §2,730 per day, or §13,650 per week, out of their magician's hats.

5 The Adventurer Career Track

Plundering Tombs And Dangerous Places

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 240 per day, § 1,200 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 3,105 per day, § 12,420 per week

It is likely that Sims in the adventure field will be doing this kind of work for the love of it more than the money, although there is plenty of financial reward, even right from the get-go.

The starting pay, 1,200 per week, isn't too bad, but this bumps up to §12,420 at the top of the career. The career's object reward, the golden skull, helps bump up Sims' moods while around it, but it cannot be sold for extra cash.

4 The Artist Career Track

Painting Pretty Pictures Of Payday

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 231 per day, § 1,155 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 4,549 per day, § 13,647 per week

Usually, art that pulls in vast sums of money is the stuff of a deceased artist, but painting is a viable path in The Sims 2 . Starting as a canvas stretcher at §231 per day, the path to artistic mastery is challenging but rewarding.

At the top, as a "visionary," Sims will earn 4,549 art smackeroons per day, or §13,647 per week. Not just anybody can pick up a brush and paint, however, as Sims will have to go through university before they can even apply for the entry job.

3 The Education Career Track

The Most Unrealistic Part Of The Game

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 215 per day, § 1,075 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 3,450 per day, § 13,800 per week

In a complete reversal from the real world, in which educators are usually vastly outpaced by businessmen, athletes, and police in terms of pay, the teaching career is the third best in the game. Even the lowest rung, playground monitors, are compensated better than bureaucrats or new military recruits.

This bizarre simulated reality where people can afford housing and groceries without taking on two or three jobs also provides leading educators with the third-best income, especially at the top. The education minister sim can expect to take home §13,800 per week. Sims will need an A+ in the Charisma, Logic, and Cleaning skills to graduate upwards in this career.

2 The Intelligence Career Track

Trading In High-Priced Secrets

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 225 per day, § 1,125 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 3,750 per day, § 15,000 per week

The snooping and secret gathering biz isn't a bad way to make some income, as the entry-level pay for intelligence in the gumshoe job pays well above 1,000 simoleons a week. Intelligence work starts at the ground level and then works up to government work and is ostensibly about keeping the nation safe.

However, even in the idealistic fantasy world of The Sims 2 , shadowy government spooks whose main preoccupation is state toppling and snowboarding are still the ones with the biggest bank accounts, with the head of the SCIA raking in 15,000 simoleons per week. Only those with high cleaning (body disposal), mechanical (cutting breaks), and logic skills (black market forces) will climb the intelligence ladder quickly.

1 The Show Business Career Track

The Road To Stardom Glitters With Gold

  • Entry-Level Wage: § 420 per day, § 2,100 per week
  • Top-Level Pay: § 5,022 per day, § 15,066 per week

Sim graduates who have recently scored their degree and are looking to rake in both fame and fortune may be interested to know that show business is the way to go. Even the lowest rung, the screen test stand-in brings §420 per day, five days a week. At the other end of that ladder is a job that pays §15k for a mere three days of work a week.

Apparently, the utopian world of The Sims 2 is obsessed with escapism, celebrity, and movies, having done away with most social ills plaguing the real world, and money-hungry Sims would be wise to take this path, but they should be sure not to apply for the pet "show biz" jobs on the application form.

item.title: Pokemon Concierge is Coming to YouTube, But There's a Catch
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon Concierge anime will be on YouTube for a limited time starting Feb 21.
  • Pokemon Day will offer fans without Netflix a chance to watch for free.

Pokemon Concierge is coming to YouTube, but only for a limited time. Fans who have missed out on watching the previously Netflix-exclusive Pokemon Concierge stop-motion animated show will want to keep an eye out for its release on YouTube.

It's already an exciting time for Pokemon fans, as the next Pokemon Presents has been announced and will arrive before February's end. As part of the plan to celebrate Pokemon Day, those who lack a Netflix subscription will be able to watch Pokemon Concierge for free via YouTube for the first time.

Pokemon Concierge is launching on YouTube starting on February 21. The Pokemon Company announced that the praised Pokemon series will be releasing sequentially, but it will only be available on YouTube for a very limited time, with The Pokemon Company noting that the event will run until March 9. While this is a very short period of time to catch the show, it shouldn't pose too much of an issue for Pokemon fans to enjoy everything it has to offer, as Pokemon Concierge has only released four episodes thus far at roughly 15 minutes each.

Should Pokemon Fans Watch Pokemon Concierge?

Pokemon Concierge has received critical acclaim and a great deal of high praise from Pokemon fans. The series is quite different than most Pokemon media, with no battles between Pokemon and a stop-motion animation style that looks quite distinct when compared to the games or the TV anime. These two elements make up the bulk of the show's appeal, with the plot revolving around a woman named Haru who finds herself working on a Pokemon resort island after visiting it to try and get over how burned out she is. The series features a variety of Pokemon, with Psyduck being a major highlight of the show.

Pokemon fans who find that they enjoy Pokemon Concierge will be happy to know that the show is slated to get more episodes. Following the success of the first four episodes, Netflix ordered a new season of the series in February 2024. It's possible that Pokemon Presents will reveal when the new season will premiere, but as a stop-motion show, it takes a considerable amount of time to produce. Animators were able to average about five seconds worth of an episode per day that the show was worked on, so even with its short length, it could take a bit before it is ready for audiences. The first four episodes releasing on YouTube may be part of an effort to encourage fans to subscribe to Netflix for season two.

item.title: LEGO Fortnite Odyssey: How To Get Amber
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Rough Amber
  • How To Get Cut Amber
  • What Is Cut Amber Used For?
    • Crafting Weapons
    • Building Chests
    • Creating Charms

LEGO Fortnite Odyssey is an ever-expanding adventure, featuring a wide variety of lands to explore, with even more being added with each major update. Fans diving into LEGO Fortnite Odyssey can jump straight into creating their very own village, crafting a vast array of weapons, and battling a diverse range of foes.

While players are on the hunt for precious resources, they may find themselves exploring the depths of various caves in search of gems. While Rubies and Sapphires are some of the most sought-after gems in the game, Amber can be acquired pretty early on. Here is how to get Rough and Cut Amber in LEGO Fortnite Odyssey .

How To Get Rough Amber

Rough Amber is a gem commonly found within Grassland Caves , easily recognizable by its distinct color. These caves generate randomly throughout the Grassland biome, but once discovered, they will be marked with a cave icon on the map, making them easy to revisit.

To mine Rough Amber, players will need a Rare or higher rarity Pickaxe. Using the appropriate tool, they can chip away at Amber nodes, which will drop Rough Amber upon being harvested , ready for collection. Once players have gotten their hands on Rough Amber, they can move on to converting it into Cut Amber.

How To Get Cut Amber

Cut Amber, like all other gems in LEGO Fortnite Odyssey , is crafted using the Gem Cutter. This Utility Station can be built via the Build Menu using the following materials:

  • 20 Metal Plates
  • 15 Bright Core
  • 5 Blast Core
  • 3 Brute Scale

Once constructed, players can interact with the Gem Cutter, select the Cut Amber recipe, and deposit Rough Amber to be converted from either their inventory or nearby Storage. Each Rough Amber converts into one Cut Amber , making it easy to track how much is needed to craft this valuable resource beforehand.

Alternatively, players can have their villagers work at the Gem Cutter to acquire Cut Amber passively. This can be done by selecting the 'collect gems' dialogue option when assigning a job to a villager. Once done, the villager will get to work crafting gems, and players can check back in with them later to receive Cut Amber.

What Is Cut Amber Used For?

Crafting Weapons

Cut Amber is primarily used to craft gem weapons and tools , similar to other gems like Sapphires and Emeralds. Players can apply Cut Amber to the blade/limb/head of their weapons and tools via the Crafting Bench, upgrading them to Epic rarity.

While weapons and tools crafted with Amber offer similar damage output to other gem-based items, Amber-crafted gear boasts the highest durability of all gems, making it an excellent choice for players looking for long-lasting equipment.

Cut Amber is also a key ingredient in crafting various weapons, including Gem Shields, Gem Flint-Knocks, and Gem Muskets , all of which can be crafted at the Crafting Bench.

That’s not all—Cut Amber is also an essential resource for crafting the Bow Caster via the Rebel Workbench , making it a valuable material for players looking to expand their arsenal.

Building Chests

In LEGO Fortnite Odyssey , there is a selection of chests that players can craft using gems, each offering increased storage compared to many other chests in the game. Cut Amber, in particular, is used to craft Amber Chests , requiring 4 Cut Amber and 2 Metal Plates to build them via the Build Menu.

Just like other Gem Chests, Amber Chests provide storage for 28 unique items , making them some of the best chests in the game.

Creating Charms

Just like other gems before it, Cut Amber is also used to craft charms via the Crafting Bench. Currently, there are only two charms that use Cut Amber in their recipes: the Epic Health Charm and the Legendary Storm Charm.

The Epic Health Charm offers 4 additional hearts along with 3 extra defense points. The Legendary Storm Charm offers the exact same benefits, only this time also allowing players to remain in the Storm biome for 6 minutes and 30 seconds.

Here's a quick breakdown of how to craft each charm:

  • Epic Health Charm: 3 Wool Thread, 5 Cut Amber, and 1 Brute Scale.
  • Legendary Storm Charm: 3 Silk Thread, 8 Cut Amber, 5 Rift Crystals, and 1 Shatterhorn Fragment.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Tony Hawk's Pro Skater Teaser Explained
item.description:
A lot of buzz currently surrounds Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 thanks to the recent launch of its Season Two Reloaded event on February 20. These mid-season events are an excellent way to revive the hype around the franchise's post-launch content cycles, with Season Two Reloaded bringing a commendable range of fresh additions to the game's multiplayer and Zombies modes, as well as Call of Duty: Warzone .

As expected, a lot of attention is being placed on the fresh multiplayer maps for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 thanks to the launch of Season Two Reloaded, with two new maps being implemented alongside a comprehensive crossover event with the TMNT franchise. With fans already getting to grips with this content, players were quick to notice a strange teaser within one of these fresh maps, giving some exciting insight into the future of the Tony Hawk 's Pro Skater series.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season Two Reloaded Puts a Spotlight on Tony Hawk's Pro Skater

Many fans have been looking forward to Season Two Reloaded of Black Ops 6 due to the early confirmation that it would feature the fan-favorite Grind map, which was first introduced to the series with 2012's Black Ops 2 . Now remastered and being added to Black Ops 6 with the name Grind Ooze, the map's skate park setting is still familiar, with a fresh coat of paint making Grind a staple of Season Two Reloaded's multiplayer offerings.

Grind also appeared as a multiplayer map in 2018's Black Ops 4 , with its three total appearances making it a growing staple of the Black Ops sub-franchise.

One change that has been made to Grind sticks out above all others, however, with one of the map's rooms featuring a mysterious date on the wall: March 4, 2025. This newly added sign also features a bare-bones logo for Tony Hawk's Pro Skater , leading to an explosion of theories and discussion among fans of the franchise. Many rumors have been circulating around THPS in recent weeks, with the skate park setting of Grind being the perfect place to finally shine a light on them.

These recent murmurings around Tony Hawk 's Pro Skater suggest that the franchise's third and fourth installments will be released as a remake, following the successful remake of THPS 1 and 2 in 2020. Another remake project seems like a logical extension of this past success, although some rumors even suggest that this upcoming project will be a brand-new entry to the Pro Skater franchise entirely.

Black Ops 6's Tease For a Future Pro Skater Project Has Already Been Verified

To dispel any doubt over this teaser in Black Ops 6 's Grind map, Tony Hawk himself took to social media to confirm that the map is indeed making reference to a future gaming project, with fans seemingly having to wait for a full reveal on March 4. Of course, Activision owns both the Tony Hawk's Pro Skater franchise and Call of Duty , with this crossover tease within Season Two Reloaded's content being a fascinating way to use the hype of its biggest franchise to push attention toward its other IPs.

Fans have been waiting for further developments for the Pro Skater franchise for some time now, with the excitement around this mystery project speaking for itself. While players still have to wait to gain a solid idea of what to expect from this upcoming game, the use of Call of Duty as a promotional tool for the title seems to have simultaneously drawn attention to both franchises in a way that would not be possible with a more traditional announcement.

item.title: Fisch: How To Get Quantum Enchantment
item.description:
While there are a plethora of rods in Roblox’s Fisch , not all of them are the best choice for anglers. However, enchantments bridge the gap, turning any basic rod into a supercharged version with extra enigmatic abilities. One of the best is the Quantum Enchantment, which is great for making tons of money fast.

This enchant gives your rod a passive ability to catch subspace-mutated fish (25% chance), which can be sold for five times their original price. While it’s not the most profitable mutation available in the game, it’s much easier to obtain compared to other options, and this guide will walk you through exactly how to get the Quantum enchantment in Fisch.

How To Get Quantum Enchant In Fisch

To get the Quantum Enchantment in Fisch , players need to use an Exalted Enchant Relic at the Keeper's Altar . Unlike normal relics, this one is a super powerful rock that grants higher-level enchantments to your rod. To get it, equip your desired rod, then head to the Statue of Sovereignty, located on the north side of the map (check near Sunstone Island). Then, dock at the area where the Shipwright NPC stands, move upward, and climb the staircase.

Under the Sovereignty Mines, you'll find another NPC named Cole. Just interact with him to buy a token for 400 in-game currency. Next, get into the elevator, insert the token into the lever, and press the 'E' key to teleport to the Keeper's Altar. Once there, walk over the massive rock in the center, hold your Exalted Enchant Relic, and interact with 'Enchant Altar' by pressing E. This will trigger light beams from the stone, and you'll be notified if your currently equipped rod has received the Quantum Enchantment. Keep in mind that it must be nighttime to use the relic. If it's daytime, use the Sundial Totem to switch to night; you can buy it for 2,000 in-game cash from Merlin. Also, getting the Quantum Enchantment on your first try isn't guaranteed—you might need to use multiple Exalted Relics. So, make sure to have plenty in your inventory.

How To Farm Exalted Enchant Relics Fast In Fisch

The fastest way to stock up on Exalted Enchant Relics in Fisch is by using the Rod of the Exalted One. This rod boosts your chances of catching a relic from the ocean to one in 800, instead of the usual one in 2,000. Exalted Relics don’t have a fixed location, so you can snag them almost anywhere. However, some of the best spots include The Depths, Ancient Isle, and Atlantean Storm.
